about_the_game:
Magic Combat
-Glacial Spike
A huge ice spikes suddenly protrude from the ground, inflicting intense physical damage on the enemy.

-Ice Lance
A spear of ice pierces through a swarm of enemies. The ice quickly spreads through their bodies, inflicting physical damage.

-Cryo Vortex
The vortex lifts the enemy into the air and deals magic damage. Smaller enemies are helpless against this assault, but larger ones cannot be hoisted up by the vortex. Consequently, they are only damaged by the magic, not lifted into the air.

-Blizzard
This ability deploys a localized snowstorm at the target location. The storm lasts for a certain amount of time and inflicts continuous magical damage to enemies who step into it. This makes it a great way to deal damage to multiple enemies at once and can be very helpful in crowded areas.

-Frost Breath
Exhale a breath of frost. It inflicts freezing damage to enemies caught in it. Enemies who stay in it for too long are frozen. It is powerful but has a short range.

-Chilling Aura
A spell of ultra-low temperature, creating an aura of freezing cold. She can maintain the aura for a certain period of time, dealing freezing damage to any enemies who enter it. Any creature who touches it for a long time is frozen .

-Rush
The ability to travel short distances instantly by concentrating magic power is a skill that takes much practice to master, but helps to avoid danger. The more proficient wizards can travel longer distances for extended periods of time, but they use up more Mana. This is why it's easy to imagine that high-level wizards are able to travel great distances very quickly.

-Ice Golem
It was an accident. The witch, who used to make snowmen by hand, tried to create them with her magical powers and an ice doll was born. Since then it has been a reassuring companion who supports her long spell chanting.

-Ice Wall
Sturdiness is key when it comes to defending yourself. So a little ingenuity on the ice spikes is essential to keeping those pesky enemies at bay. Walls that emit cold air can freeze nearby enemies, but they don't seem to cause any damage. However, the frigid temperature is enough to made them extremely uncomfortable.

-Spell Chain
You will be caught off guard if you think chanting is the only way to release your magic. there are many other ways to release your magic. Chanting is just one method. This snow witch seems to be particularly good at planting the next spell in the one she has unleashed. It's as if she has a special talent for it. The snow witch is always one step ahead, and her opponents never know what's coming next.

-Spell Combo
One relatively easy way to push one's limits is to exalt. One example is the battle cry uttered by warriors.
The rhythmic spell releasing will give her pleasure. The more she combos them, the more their power leaps.
A gauge will appear for a moment in the middle of the screen after she releases the instant spell. Release the next spell at the right time in the center of the gauge.


Adventurous Companions

- Ride her beloved unicorn horse and play with your enemies.
- The more powerful the magic, the longer it takes to concentrate, so summon your trusty golem to act as your shield. He scales in strength and size depending on the magic and skill you invest in him.
- Some of the enemies you defeat will drop their souls on rare occasions. You can summon them as companions at a cost during the adventure to form your squad. They have levels, which are permanently inherited.


Growth System

Permanent growth elements:

-Perk
At the end of your adventure, you will receive a score based on your play. Spend them to build up permanent power-ups.

-Companions
As mentioned above, the strength of your companions is inherited. Your companions will become your reassuring allies in your adventures.


Growth during adventures:

Schnee has no levels and grows with loot from enemies and the map during adventures. You can obtain spells of random performance and enchant them to your liking in terms of power, range, and chain probability. Think about synergy with her own status boosts and build your own build.

THE STORY

As you continue your adventure, artwork about the world and the witch's origins will open up.

name: SCHNEE

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64 Bit
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: SCHNEE is a third-person action rogue-lite game created by one-man developer. Build your own builds from loot, use defeated enemies as your companions, and challenge yourself to see if you can defeat the ruler.
supported_languages: English, French, German, Spanish - Spain, Portuguese - Brazil, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Japanese
